CTR.Q: What type of chart is this?

VEC.Q: How many ridgelines are in this ridgeline chart?
VEC.A: There are {6} slices in this chart.

SRP.Q: What is the spatial relationship of the peak of Stock Market relative to the peak of Real Estate in terms of vertical (above/below) and horizontal (left/right) directions?
SRP.A: The peak of  Stock Market is to the {left} of the peak of Real Estate.

VPR.Q: What distribution pattern does the ridgeline representing Peer-to-Peer Lending show?
VPR.A: The ridgeline representing Peer-to-Peer Lending shows a {Single Peak Distribution}.

VPR.Q: At what value do  Venture Capital reach its peaks?

EVJ.Q: Which ridgeline has the highest peak
EVJ.A: The ridgeline representing {Real Estate} has the highest peak.

EVJ.Q: Which label has the highest density at X =-3.3?
EVJ.A: At X =-3.3,the label with the highest density is {Real Estate}

NF.Q: Which countries in the ridgeline chart have ridgeline peaks exceed 2? Please list the countries and corresponding peak values.
Which countries in the ridgeline chart have ridgeline peaks below 9? Please list the countries and corresponding peak values.
NF.A: {Real Estate}'s peak at {-4},{Bonds}'s peak at {-2},{Peer-to-Peer Lending}'s peak at {-5},{Stock Market}'s peak at {-5}

NC.Q: Which one has a larger X value at the peak of its ridgeline: Bonds or Real Estate?
NC.A: {Bonds} has a larger X value at the peak of its ridgeline.

NC.Q: Which one has a larger X value at the peak of its ridgeline: Venture Capital or Peer-to-Peer Lending?
NC.A: {Venture Capital} has a larger X value at the peak of its ridgeline.

NC.Q: Which one has a larger X value at the peak of its ridgeline: Peer-to-Peer Lending or Bonds?
NC.A: {Bonds} has a larger X value at the peak of its ridgeline.

NC.Q: Which one has a larger X value at the peak of its ridgeline: Commodities or Real Estate?
NC.A: {Commodities} has a larger X value at the peak of its ridgeline.

MSR.Q: How many ridges have their peak located to the right of the average X value across all ridges?
MSR.A: There are {2} ridges whose peaks are located to the right of the average X value.

MSR.Q: What is the label of the ridge with the largest span along the mountain height?
MSR.A: The ridge with the largest span in the mountain height is {Peer-to-Peer Lending}
